title.native: キャンディ・キャンディ

description:
This story is about a girl, Candy, who is a orphan. She is a nice and optimistic girl and she has a warm heart. When she was a child, she lived in an orphanage called Pony's Home. She had a good friend called Ann. And she met the "handsome boy on the hill" who is a important person in her life, on the hill behind the orphanage.

She was adopted by the Loka's family. What's awaiting her are the bad-hearted Leo and his sister, Eliza. One day, in the rose garden, she met a boy, who is identical to the "handsome boy on the hill" who she had met in her childhood. The boy is called Antony. Thereafter, a fantastic story that she has never expected begins.

(Source: AnimeNfo)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Bullying

tags.name: Adoption

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

title.native: キャンディ・キャンディ
キャンディ・キャンディ
キャンディ・キャンディ 春の呼び声

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm

Mitsuko Horie is a Japanese seiyuu and singer. She was born in Yamato, Kanagawa, Japan. She is most known to American anime fans as the voice of Sailor Galaxia, but in all Latin-America she is know as the "Candy-Candy" opening theme singer.

[Official Website](https://yumicomix.net/wordpress/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100007066442196)

She is also the cousin of fellow manga artist Satsuki Igarashi; a member of [Clamp](https://anilist.co/staff/96877).

In 1968, as a third-year high school student at the Asahi Gaoka High School in Sapporo, Hokkaidō, she made her debut in Shueisha's Ribon manga magazine with Shiroi Same no iru Shima.
She won the 1st Kodansha Manga Award in 1977 as the artist of Candy Candy
She is a Japanese writer who is best-known for being the author of the manga and anime series *Candy Candy*.

A highly prolific and an extremely influential animator.

Know for his experimentation with the timing of keyframes, his dynamic poses, and his peculiar effects Kanada pioneered a number of techniques and concepts that permeated and shaped the Japanese animation industry, influencing not only his peers but also the generations to come.

Kanada's ability and his tendency to be very personal with his drawings, even to the point of ignoring storyboards if the situation required, popularized in the industry the concept of letting the individual animator's talents shine instead of being uniformed into anonymity. This precept is still respected today and it's one of the reasons Japanese animation is so distinctly unique. His career is also a testament to his ethos that expressive and vibrant animation is not achieved simply through increasing the number of frames but through playing with movement, poses and timing.

In the early '00s, Kanada became an employee at Square Enix.

Notable Square Enix titles in which he was credited:

~!
- 2002, Final Fantasy XI (Motion Capture, Animation Director)
- 2005, Musashiden II: Blade Master (Storyboard)
- 2006, Dawn of Mana (Facial Setting)
- 2007, Final Fantasy 4 DS Version (Storyboard)
- 2009, Final Fantasy XIII (Storyboard Director) - *Posthumous credit.*
- 2011, Final Fantasy XIII-2 (Storyboard) - *Posthumous credit.*
- 2012, Dragon Quest X (Storyboard)  - *Posthumous credit.* !~
He was a music composer for anime, drama and jidaigeki from Tokyo, Japan. He passed away from renal failure.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤道廣)

Founder and representative director of Sound Ring.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山口康男)

Yamaguchi started his career in 1963 as an assistant director at Toei Douga's Tokyo Studio and later transferred to the Production Department where he conducted planning on future series. He planned titles such as Wolf Boy Ken, Ge Ge Ge no Kitarou, Getter Robo, King Kong, and became an anime picture producer, producing titles including Candy, Candy, Story of Maple Town and Tatsu no ko Tarou. As chief of the production section, he produced Sailor Moon.
Tadami Shimokawa is an art director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦田又治)

Retired art director formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).
He is a veteran screenwriter for television anime series.
